caption.p:
Postulated schematic of bacterial coinfection with SARS‐CoV‐2 infection. It has been proposed when SARS‐ CoV‐2 infects lung cells can damage the cells and the lung infrastructure.
160 This situation attracts neutrophil and macrophages to the site of infection and promoting the inflammation.
160 Finally, the changed situation and epithelial damage can cause bacteria to adhere to and invasion of the cells and proliferation. MQ, macrophage; SARS‐CoV‐2, severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2
